Ballad of the Tiger
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Poetry: Ballad of the Tiger
By The ShaMan on Thursday, December 11, 2003 - 12:01 pm:

WhiteHound, Bargest, Ryulon;
The list of Tigers goes on and on.
Immense power is a gift,
Speed of winds gives them lift.

Thunder flys from their horns,
Icy mountains are where they're born.
Are they feline or are they hound?
In a battle, they're never downed.

There's many Tigers, great and small,
I wish that I could train them all.
They'll break opponents with mighty jaws,
And take a bow on regal paws.

By The ShaMan on Thursday, December 11, 2003 - 12:04 pm:

My friend PattonGeneral keeps telling me that the "speed of winds" part is dumb because it makes it sound like I took that from the Monster Rancher show which he says is not affiliated with Tecmo.

I just wanted to let you all know that that is not the case.I just thought that wind was a good metaphor for speed.

By Brick on Thursday, December 11, 2003 - 08:02 pm:

I still think it's a good line:p Good job!
